FEATURED WORK

Selected Projects

Highlights from 67 completed projects across federated learning security, fraud detection, and production AI.

SignGuard: Cryptographic FL Defense

Novel defense combining ECDSA signatures with anomaly detection and reputation scoring to protect federated learning from poisoning attacks.

94.5% attack detection rate with minimal overhead on honest participants
PyTorch Flower ECDSA Reputation Systems

Steganography: PVD+LSB+Modulo

Published research implementing combined PVD, LSB, and modulo encoding for image steganography with AES-128 CTR_DRBG randomization.

RESEARCH

Open Research Questions

Problems I'm actively thinking about ‚Äî open to collaboration and academic partnerships.

Q1

Can we build verifiable trust between financial institutions in federated learning without revealing private data?

Exploring zero-knowledge proofs for provable model integrity in cross-institution FL, so banks can collaborate on fraud detection without trusting each other blindly.

Zero-Knowledge Proofs Federated Learning Financial Systems
Q2

How do we make phishing detection explainable when the model is distributed across institutions?

Investigating local LLMs to generate human-understandable explanations for federated phishing classifiers ‚Äî bridging the gap between ML accuracy and analyst trust.

Explainable AI LLMs Phishing Detection
Q3

What's the real-world cost of Byzantine resilience in production federated systems?

Most FL defense papers benchmark on MNIST/CIFAR. I'm studying how defenses like SignGuard perform under realistic banking data distributions and adversary models.

Byzantine Resilience Production FL Empirical Security

Pursuing MRes in Computer Security & Machine Learning

Applying to research-focused programs (2026‚Äì2027) to deepen my work at the intersection of cryptographic verification and adversarial ML. Open to supervision opportunities in federated learning security, privacy-preserving ML, or applied cryptography.

PUBLICATIONS

Published Research

LNNS vol. 285 Springer

Improving the Imperceptibility of Pixel Value Difference and LSB Substitution Based Steganography Using Modulo Encoding

Novel combined encoding method for image steganography. Evaluated across 131 images with 10 message sizes each (1,310 total trials), measuring PSNR, MSE, and SSIM quality metrics with AES-128 CTR_DRBG randomization.

Steganography AES-128 PVD/LSB/Modulo OpenCV
View Publication
